candidates.name: Pat Wall
candidates.why_elect: Because I am open, honest and believe in a two way dialogue between representatives and the public. Furthermore, in my day job I work with many local councils on climate change and GHG related issues, and can bring much needed climate perspectives to council.
candidates.why_stand: I believe that Coasters are ready to talk about climate change, and they need Councillors who are not in denial about it. I think Coasters are seeing the impacts with their own eyes, and they want someone to carry their concerns to council.

candidates.name: Glenn Irving
candidates.why_elect: I have been in both management and governance roles, and have a proven record in getting things done. I have existing relationships with people from a wide variety of organisations, and an engineering background that will enable me to make well informed decisions for our region.
candidates.why_stand: I'm proud to call the Coast home, but know that we can do a better job of caring for this incredible land we have been entrusted with. I also want it to be a place my children are proud of, and care for alongside all of us who live here.

candidates.name: Laura Coll McLaughlin
candidates.why_elect: I'm a licensed cadastral surveyor and planning consultant. I hold a Bachelor of Surveying with First Class Honours and associate memberships of the NZ Planning Institute and Survey and Spatial NZ. I'm Chair of the HBWCT board, an adult education tutor and have governance training. I'm a sixth-generation West Coaster.
candidates.why_stand: I am passionate about local participation in local decision making. I want to help empower our community to determine its own future in a way that is proactive, sustainable and responsible. I love this place.

candidates.name: John Hill
candidates.why_elect: As a qualified industrial chemist I have developed a broad knowledge of relevant issues such as climate change, waste management, coastal erosion. As I have lived in many towns around the UK, Australia and NZ I bring outside experience to our small community.
candidates.why_stand: I came to the coast to plan for a retirement in a stress free rural environment. After 13 years I have not retired but love living here with no close neighbours and lovely surroundings. However issues such as reliable health care must be addressed.
